content: In our single server, we use Docker containerization technology. to host multiple apps in different docker containers. For installing Zulip on the same server hence we are considering using Zulip-Docker for that case. However since zulip-docker is not as good as the main zulip install, I was wondering whether it is possible to install the main zulip in kind of a sub-folder (environment) way. Such that I could install in a folder/environment like Zulip and it treats that as root.
If that's not possible we'd have to go ahead with the docker-zulip image.
@Abhigyan Khaund we don't support that kind of sub-folder installation.
Oh okay. Then I suppose we can go ahead with the docker image. There aren't major issues reported with its installation right?
